info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 10:19PM MDT until June 30 at 12:30AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central New Mexico, including the following county, west central Roosevelt.
* WHEN...Until 1230 AM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1018 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving slowly southwest across Roosevelt County. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The heaviest rainfall has occurred around Floyd. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elida, Kenna and Floyd. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Remember, ditches are deadly. A gentle flow of water can become a raging torrent in a few minutes.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM MDT MONDAY
